text: Seven Islands of Bombay The Old Woman's Island, also known as Little Colaba is one of the seven islands composing the city of Mumbai, India, and part of the historic Old Bombay. The Colaba Causeway built in 1838, connected this last island to the mainland of Bombay, along with the island of Colaba. ==References== ==External links== * History of Colaba and Cuffe Parade * Bombay - History of Reclamation Category:Islands of Mumbai
title: Old Woman's Island
